Name: Small Head of Alexander the Great in Marble
Description: The small marble head depicts Alexander the Great with his well-known features: the upward look of the eyes, the sharp nose, and the snaky hair. There is a crack in the neck. Heads of Alexander the Great such as this one have religious significance.The cult of Alexander the Great became the official religion in Egypt, with special rituals and ceremonies such as the annual celebration of the founding of Alexandria. During the festival, the priests decorated the statues of Alexander and carried them through the temples. The public also participated in the festivities. Numerous relatively smaller statues also were placed in houses and villas.
